means: 使（极度）痛苦，折磨( agonize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: All the time they agonized and prayed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们一直在忍受痛苦并且祈祷.

sentence.Network_en: She agonized herself with the thought of her loss.
sentence.Network_cn: 她念念不忘自己的损失,深深陷入痛苦之中.

sentence.Network_en: The military responses we made were much agonized over.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的军事反应引起了大量痛苦的呻吟.

17. 濒死期（agonal stage）：又称临终状态。机体各系统的功能发生严重障碍，脑干以上部位处于深度抑制状态，表现为意识模糊或消失，各.
agomphosis无牙，缺牙，牙动agonal breathing 终末频死呼吸agonist 兴奋剂，激动剂
agonal leukocytosis 濒死期白细胞增多 agony 濒死痛苦 agoraphobia 广场恐怖 agrammatism 语法缺失 agranulocyte 无粒细胞 agranulocytosis 粒细胞缺乏症 agraphia 书写不.

entry.def: Agonized describes something that you say or do when you are in great physical or mental pain.

example.tran: 他脸上极其痛苦的表情

auth_sentence.content: Hugh was making a number of agonized facial gestures to Jen.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hugh was making a number of agonized facial gestures to Jen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hugh was making a number of agonized facial gestures to Jen.

auth_sentence.content: "I give up, " he wrote in an agonized page-one story in Le Monde.
auth_sentence.res_content: "I give up, " he wrote in an agonized page-one story in Le Monde.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "I give up, " he wrote in an agonized page-one story in Le Monde.

auth_sentence.content: Where the former film is agonized and sullen, the latter is mischievous and restive, daring us to be dismayed by its insolence.
auth_sentence.res_content: Where the former film is agonized and sullen, the latter is mischievous and restive, daring us to be dismayed by its insolence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Where the former film is agonized and sullen, the latter is mischievous and restive, daring us to be dismayed by its insolence.
